sense.name: a pattern of regular intersecting lines
sense.examples: A Go game board is a grid of squares formed from 19 by 19 lines intersecting. The directory says the street is located at A6 on the map grid. The city's streets form a grid.

sense.name: a regional distribution system of electrical power
sense.examples: The component failure caused a blackout across the Northeastern grid. The second reactor was not connected to the grid until 1985. Bob lived off the grid for two years in a cabin without even running water.

sense.name: a collection of connected computers
sense.examples: The physics department has its own computational grid for performing computationally-intensive operations. The company rapidly tracks inventory on a national level through its data grid. Such equipment grids can control large telescopes from remote locations.

sense.name: a grating or grill, usually metal
sense.examples: The metal grids had been pulled across the entrance to the shop. Mary stood over the metal grid of the floor heater.

sense.name: football field
sense.examples: We'll see some action this afternoon as the rivals face off on the grid.

sense.name: designated starting position for cars on a racetrack
sense.examples: The Ferrari was first away from the grid.

sense.name: conductive metal plate in a storage battery
sense.examples: What type of metal are the grids in storage batteries made of?

sense.name: a conducting electrode inside an electron tube
sense.examples: Electrons flow between the cathode and anode via the grid.

sense.name: component of a photocomposition machine which has the etched characters
sense.examples: The characters used in the photocomposition are etched onto the grid.

sense.name: cooking surface for grilling meats
sense.examples: The chef rotated the salmon 90 degrees on the hot grid to give the skin a scored design.
